intro: Crucianella gilanica subsp. gilanica, commonly known as the Gilan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caspian Sea region. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and riverbanks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its stems are erect and branched. This subspecies is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
